characters: 'FOR IN THAT SLEEP OF DEATH WHAT DREAMS MUST COME.'
WE HEAR THE SOUNDS OF CHEWING --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: a word carved in stone: 'DREAMS'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to reveal the full inscription:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's carved on a large obelisk grave marker. Beneath the  inscription is a name: THIBAULT, and dates: 1861-1917.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL FURTHER BACK: Perched on the marker is a stone effig the angel of death, wings spread wide, half-smile on her  face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AND FURTHER BACK: Ropes are wrapped around the marker. Th ropes tighten, and the marker is suddenly PULLED OVER, th CAMERA taking off with it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The marker is dragged along, through deep grass ... then a bump it's on a dirt road, then over a bridge. It's drag by a team of horses. Rain starts to fall. The marker pull away, continuing on toward --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burgess Manor, a dark outline against the gray marble sky

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garage was once the carriage house. Several luxury ca circa 1930s, fill the bays. The marker lies in an empty o Two men stand nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One is RODERICK BURGESS. A commanding presence, radiating charisma both disturbing and mesmerizing. He is in his ea twenties, but his soul is much older -- and darker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other is SMITH. Middle-aged, face drawn, he peers out the garage furtively. He's worried, preoccupied. A white  clerical collar is almost hidden beneath his coat and sca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hopefully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain will wash out the tracks ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burgess moves slowly to the marker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've found it. Crowley couldn't. Mathers  couldn't. Only I could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't see anybody on the  road ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burgess isn't listening to him; he's preoccupied with the marker. He examines it gleefully, reverently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thibault had it stolen from the Vatican  Library -- that's common knowledge. But  then it disappeared. He told Yeats he'd  destroyed it. But he didn't. He couldn't.  And now -- I've found it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think anyone saw me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burgess finally looks at the man. Cocks his head, amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Vicar. No one saw you. No  one knows what you've done -- except you  and me. And God. (insinuating)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like your other little ...  peccadilloes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Vicar shuts his eyes in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please ... (looks at Burgess)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What they say is true. You are the most  wicked man alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chuckles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always liked that title.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs up a sledge hammer, startling the other man -- a intended. He smiles, and SMASHES the hammer down on the  marker. Another blow. Another --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The marker is hollow. Hidden inside is a large oilskin  bundle. Burgess drops the sledge. Lifts out the bundle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burgess unwraps it carefully. Inside is a thick book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Magdalene Grimoire. Finally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The book is heavy, leather bound, brittle with age. Burge pages through it greedily. It is filled with tiny, crampe writing, arcane diagrams, drawings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it then? You can do it now? You  can ... capture the angel of death?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death isn't an angel. She's one of the  Endless ... who existed long before  angels ... and will exist long after the  final cherubim has sung its last hosanna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heresy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For your sake, hope it's not. The  Magdalene Grimoire is all the Order of  Ancient Mysteries needed. With it, we  will summon and imprison Death. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I will command who shall live ... and  who shall die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then ... you'll keep our bargain? (no answer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please -- you'll keep your promise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, Vicar. You have my word. You  won't die. And you will never have to  stand in the judgment of your God. (clasps him on the shoulder; cheery)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He exits the garage, for the main house. Smith looks down the marker, at the shattered effigy of death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He catches himself, realizing he shouldn't be praying. Hi eyes fill with tears; he slumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have I done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candles burn in the darkness. Robed figures inscribe a la circle on the floor -- chalk white against the black ston Runic characters decorate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is midnight, Lord Magus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is time. Elspeth, love..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful YOUNG WOMAN nods adoringly. She crouches on a fours at Burgess' feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Items are placed on her back: a ceremonial bowl, inside w floats a human heart. A long twisted knife. A feather. Co The Magdalene Grimoire. She is a human altar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burgess opens the book. He begins to intone, displaying t items as he names them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I give you coin I made from a stone. I  give you a song I stole from the dirt. I  give you a knife from under the hills.  And a stick I stuck through a dead man's  eye. I give you a claw I ripped from a  rat. I give you a name, and the name is  lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jabs his forearm with the knife. Blood drips onto the  feather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I give you blood from out of my vein, and  a feather I pulled from an angel's wing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws the feather into the circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I summon with poison, and summon with  pain. I open the way and open the gates.  Come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The acolytes echo the word 'Come.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I summon you in the names of the old  lords. Namtar. Allatu. Morax. Naberius.  Klesh. Vepar. Maymon. We summon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The acolytes chant 'Come.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the dark they call you ... into the  dark they call you. Coin and song, knife  and stick ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the center of the circle, the air SHIMMERS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claw and name, blood and feather ... Here  in the darkness ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The air SOLIDIFIES, taking shape --  The acolytes echo 'Here in the darkness.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here in the darkness, we summon you  together. COME!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is FLASH  --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and a black-cloaked FIGURE materializes in mid-air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His head and face are covered by a HELM that looks like t skull of some dead ancient god (which it is).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large, vibrant heart-shaped RUBY adorns his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small leather POUCH hangs from one hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and then the figure collapses. He lies splayed on the  floor, in the center of the circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The acolytes are hushed, amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did it. I don't believe it. We did it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We failed. This isn't Death. Damn it  to hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence from the others as Burgess considers the figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even so ... strip him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Acolyte nods, reaches across the circle --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and SCREAMS as his arm TWISTS violently, torqued by so unseen force. Burgess shoves him away from the circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fool! If you'd broken the circle, he  could have escaped!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs Elspeth by the hair, slashes with the knife --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elspeth's head lolls to one side. Burgess catches her bef she collapses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My god --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burgess lets Elspeth fall to the ground. He holds his han up like a surgeon. They are stained with Elspeth's blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful not to break the circle, Burgess steps close to t captured FIGURE. With bloody hands he strips off the cloa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the ruby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the pouch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then he removes the helm --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The face revealed is bone white, framed by jet black hair aquiline nose and high cheekbones, a face carved from fin marble -- save the eyes. These are obsidian, deep as the  universe -- and staring directly at Burgess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is the personification of dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is SANDMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burgess draws back, unsettled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaken)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I think, at day's end, this will have  been a very profitable evening's work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a gesture, he orders the acolytes out. Burgess conti to stare at Sandman as he backs out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to the room pivots on an axis; the other side is brick. It is clearly a secret room. The door swings shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman lies on the floor, unmoving. And then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- a single, small tear slips down his cheek --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From somewhere in the empty room comes the SOUND of water DRIPPING, slowly. In the corner, a drop of water slips fr pipe, courses down the wall to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A scratchy recording of 'Dream a Little Dream of Me' fade and out. We see images, drifting, dreamlike, drawn from n reels, photographs, drawings: A bread line. Gandhi. Astai and Rogers, dancing. Flagpole sitting and dance marathons Hitler at a rally ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Sandman's eyes. He's sitting up now, hugging hi knees to his chest. But still unmoving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burgess, nearly twenty years older, sits in a chair oppos him, studying him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you can grant me boons. Power.  Immortality. A promise you won't seek  revenge. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well? I know you can understand me. Say  something!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman does not respond. Does not move. Just stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door pivots, and ALEX BURGESS pushes in. He's seven, he wants nothing more than to please his father. He carri large folio, dusty and falling apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir! I found it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Alex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? Here. In the Paginarum Fulvarum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leafs through the folio. It is filled with old drawing and paintings. We catch quick glimpses of figures titled  Destiny, Death, Desire, figures we will learn more of lat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said he had to be one of the Endless.  But it wasn't Death. And it's not Desire,  or Despair -- or Destiny. That'd been  brilliant if you'd caught him -- um ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burgess has fixed him with a stern look, humbling him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, anyway ... Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finds the drawing he's looking for, displays it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Heirmonyous Bosch-like portrait of Sandman in his helm cloak. Terrifying. The drawing is inscribed 'Here is said thee Kinge of Dremes.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? He's Dream. (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morpheus, Lord Shaper. the Prince of  Stories ... the Sandman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burgess takes the folio, examines it, nodding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I was hoping you'd work it out on  your own one day. And you have. Well  done, Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, father --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chastised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Lord Magus. (gathers his courage)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir ... Since you know his true name,  can't you make him do what you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cretin. That kind of magick is too  trifling for him and his ilk. The Endless  are not mortal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if they're gods --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are not gods. Gods come and go. Gods  fade away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But ... are we safe? What if his brothers  and sisters come after us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burgess broods on this ... glances at a shelf. On it lie  Sandman's helm, pouch and ruby. He fingers the helm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Protection can be had. Deals can be  struck ...  (to Alex)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've never seen a summoning, have you,  son? Tonight, you will. We'll conjure a  demon of hell. And trade this -- (lifts the helm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- for our safety. (more)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to leave)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inform the acolytes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Lord Magus. But what about ... what  about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He will not get out unless the circle is  broken. And the circle will not be broken  unless I order it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves, Alex trailing. Sandman watches them go..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the corner, a DROP of water slips from a pipe, courses down the wall to the floor. Twenty years has worn a chann in the stone; the drop flows along it. And then another .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More time goes by, more images, dreamlike: McCarthy in th Senate. Lenin reviewing a May Day parade. Walt Disney ope Disneyland. Hula hoops, 3-D movies, Elvis. The KKK marchi on Washington. All accompanied by the Everly Brothers'  version of 'All I Ever Do is Dream.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door pushes open. Burgess enters, slightly drunk. At  sixty, he's still handsome and vital. With him is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL. Beautiful in the extreme, radiating sexual heat.  Dressed in the counterculture style of the day. She is  giggling -- then draws up short at the sight of Sandman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God ... it's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She circles Sandman slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex, now in his twenties, has followed them into the roo he watches Rachel's every step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's magnificent. And you caught him,  Lord Magus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burgess smiles -- but it fades when Alex speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, it was a mistake. He was trying  to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he a demon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's more dangerous than any demon I've  known.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scoops up the pouch from the shelf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. This is what I told you about. (opens the pouch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stuff that dreams are made of ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Made on.' Quote it right, you old idiot  ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes unheard as Burgess sprinkles some of the sand int his own hand. It sparkles. He holds it out to Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No matter how much you take out, there's  always some left ... Try it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I ..? Sniff it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sniff it, swallow it, rub it on your skin  ... pour it in your eyes ... it doesn't  matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel considers. Puts one finger in her mouth, moistenin it, rolls it in the sand. With a wicked grin, eyes never  leaving Burgess', she trails her hand down toward her jea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burgess stares, panting slightly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her fingers slips beneath the waistband. Between her legs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Rachel ... You are a wild one ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles, shows her teeth -- her eyes go wide. She is  seeing something beautiful, rapturous. She is seeing life a dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh ... oh, my ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roderick sets the pouch down, moves to Rachel. Begins to  nuzzle her neck, undress her. She responds to him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- but her eyes never leave the pouch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex's gaze lingers on Rachel as he backs away. Then he s discreetly out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Sandman continues to watch ... and wait ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens. Alex slips in, followed by Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he really what old Roddy says he is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know ... Stupid old Roddy  should've died by now and left me in  charge ... he really can work some sort  of magic ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sand ... that was magic ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex grabs the pouch. Considers, then takes the ruby as w He heads for the door. Rachel catches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please ... just a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex considers. Opens the pouch. Rachel pinches out some  sand, sniffs it. It takes effect immediately, transportin her. Alex grabs her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls against him, grabs for the pouch. He lets her t it. She clutches it. One last look at Sandman; then she  allows herself to be led from the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman gazes after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the corner, a DROP of water slips from the pipe, cours down the wall to the floor. Flows along the channel, whic now leads to a small pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More time goes by. Nixon, victorious over McGovern. An ES meeting, slam dancing punks, a 'Star Wars' line. The  Ayatollah exhorting a mob. The song is 'Dreamweaver.' It  skips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man -- call him DAVID -- sleeps fitfully in the one-roo efficiency apartment. He wears the pants and shirt of a  postal uniform; the rest is scattered on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV is on, volume low, showing Bicentennial celebratio news footage. Traffic NOISE comes from outside, mixed wit the sound of a DOG BARKING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the sounds FADE OUT, save the BARKING. It becomes  rhythmic, constant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David's eyes flutter open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CORINTHIAN is a young man with silver hair, whipsaw b clothed in white silk pants and T-shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wears small, round dark glasses and an amused smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. How did you get in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to talk to you, David. To tell  you that you are not fulfilling your  potential.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not? Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm your friend. You can call me the  Corinthian. I want to show you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gestures to the TV. The dog continues to BARK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SCREEN: what looks like the opening credits of a mid- seventies cop show: studio backlot heroics and car chases lingers on a POV shot: approaching a parked red Torino. T figures inside, one blond, one brunette -- both women. Th hair is almost ridiculously long and straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David leans forward at the sight of the women. His fists  clench. The Corinthian smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've shown other people things like this,  David. All through history. But none as  special as you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SCREEN: the POV shot continues. A .44 appears in frame and FIRES. The windshield shatters, and the brunette's he snaps back -- a bloodless, TV killing. The blond looks up smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gun FIRES again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David's eyes fill with tears of joy. The rhythmic BARKING continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, David? If you can dream it --  you can be it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David saddens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all this is? This isn't really  happening? This is a dream?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sadly, yes. That's the only way  I've  ever talked to special people. But ... (David brightens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something has happened, David. And now  you can help me. You can free me. As I  can free you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian smiles, spreads his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up, David. Just wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: David, sleeping fitfully. His eyes flutter open looks at the TV. The bicentennial footage continues. NORM SOUND has returned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a dream ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand drops on his shoulder. The Corinthian's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He places something on the bed in front of David -- a .44 REVOLVER. David picks it up reverently. Heavy and real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-bye, David. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rises, heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Will I ever see you again? Will you  ... talk with me some more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll always be here, David. I'll always  talk to you. Just listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once again, the SOUND fades away, isolating the BARKING D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David listens, nods. The Corinthian nods back, then opens door and leaves. The door shuts quietly -- and NORMAL SOU returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David lifts the revolver. Spins the cylinder. POINTS it a the CAMERA --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burgess leans heavily on a cane. He is now a withered,  fragile old man. He stares at Sandman, who stares back.  Suddenly, Burgess is wracked by a violent coughing attack gets himself under control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your fault! Damn you! (resigned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You aren't Death, but you live forever.  You haven't aged a day since I caught  you. You could have given me power beyond  my wildest dreams. (chokes back tears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ... I didn't have to get so old. I  shouldn't have had to get old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has another violent coughing attack. Slips to one knee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it, let it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another person is in the cellar. She looks about nineteen Long black hair, pale skin. A kinda groovy, perky neo-pun girl-next-door, dressed in black jeans and camisole. An a the Egyptian symbol for life, hangs from her neck. She lo genuinely concerned for Burgess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we recognize her face: it was the face of the angel o death on the grave marker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gestures. He looks down. Sees --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His own body. Lying on the ground near his feet. Dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ... you aren't Death ... are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEATH smiles, half-shrugs. She knows she's not what he  expected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to catch you once. Got him  instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I ... are you going to punish me? Am I  bound for hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just here to take you from this world  to the next ... Destinations are up to  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh ... I am. I'm going to hell. I'm  Roderick Burgess. I'm the most wicked man  alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a bright smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes Burgess' hand. Looks up at Sandman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (genuine sadness)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, little brother ... there's  nothing I can do. I ... I miss you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She and Burgess fade into the shadows. We hear a SOFT  FLUTTERING SOUND, like WINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gone. Just Burgess' body on the floor ... And Sandm watching. The water still DRIPS; the pool in the corner o the room is quite deep now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Images leading to the present day. A student stands defia in front of a tank. An evangelist breaks down in tears. A white Bronco moves slowly down the freeway. Demonstrators join hands in a field of brightly colored quilts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the corner, a DROP of water slips from a pipe, courses down the wall to the floor. Flows along the carved channe the stone, into the pool --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pool OVERFLOWS. A line of water trickles its way acro the floor, across the faded chalk runes of the circle. It wipes the line of chalk away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The circle is broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a cry of pain, Sandman falls forward, collapses outs the circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rolls over. Weak. In pain. His lips part. His voice is filled with dark mystery, a voice that can inspire dreams command nightmares:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At ... last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gathers himself, rises. Stands, a bit unsteady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down at the remains of Roderick Burgess, decayed brittle with age. He picks up the skull. Regards it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman squeezes. The skull SHATTERS. There is no joy in eyes as pieces sift out from between his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman looks at the shelf that once held his belongings. Empty. He looks away. Moves toward the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sodium lamps cast a sickly yellow light on the nearly-emp lot. A WOMAN hurriedly click-clacks toward her car, keys  already out. She unlocks the door, opens it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone slams it shut: the CORINTHIAN. He has seemingly  appeared from nowhere. He smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful night to be alive, don't you  think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She crouches slightly, flexes her fingers. Her red-painte fingernails glint. She knows self-defense. The Corinthian draws a knife lazily, steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Woman kicks at his shin -- he avoids it. But she brin her foot down on his -- hard. She grabs either side of hi head, her thumbs clawing for his eyes behind his sunglass

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She SCREAMS, yanks her hands back. She crouches, staring at her hands, which drip with blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian straightens his sunglasses. The woman craw under the car. The Corinthian grabs her ankle -- she SCRE clutches at the pavement, grabs for the tire, as she is  inexorably dragged out from under the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I won't kill you. That would  draw all sorts of the wrong kind of  attention. I just want to look into your  eyes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, she is no longer being dragged. She twists, pee out from under the car --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian stands still, looking up toward the night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's back. He's BACK. No! It's not fair!  I won't allow it. I won't go back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down at the woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I can stop him. I'm not  going back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cowers in terror. Opens her eyes -- the Corinthian is gone. She blinks -- it's as if he was never there --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- except for her hands. The Woman drags herself out from under the car. Raises her hands --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her THUMBS BLEED, as though bitten through by tiny sharp  teeth. She starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boarded up, windows broken, overgrown. Sandman stands und the night sky. Reaches out his arms. Shadows move, and  darkness stretches towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman wraps the shadows around him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and he is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SANDSTORM rages; there is the WHITE NOISE of the howlin wind. Shadows flow inside of it, and Sandman's dark outli emerges, one arm raised, a shield against the wind. He pe ahead. In front of him is:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ornately carved. Flanked by gargoyles. Sandman is relieve the sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gates of Horn and Ivory. Once  through, I will see my castle ... I will  see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gates part before him. Sandman steps through --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- my home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman stares in horror --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahead of him are the remains of Sandman's Dream Palace.  Beautiful, once, but now overgrown and broken -- its glas walls CRACKED, its delicate spires BROKEN. The majestic  columns have fallen into RUBBLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman slumps before it as if struck down. From nearby c the sound of gentle weeping -- and a voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breaks your heart, my Lord, doesn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucien?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the shadow of the gates sits LUCIEN, Sandman's librari He rises to his feet. Pointed ears and round spectacles,  dressed as a clown might dress for a formal dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at Sandman, smiling, tears in his eyes. We real he's weeping at Sandman's return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One and the same, my Lord. (he bows)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At your service, as always. (his voice cracks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucien takes a breath. Wipes the tears from his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? You are the incarnation of  this dreamtime, Lord. With you gone, the  place ... it started to crumble ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes off his spectacles, cleans them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was aware of it in my Library. Slowly,  the words began to fade. Some time after  you vanished, my books became volumes of  blank paper. The next day the whole  library was gone. (puts on his glasses)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never found it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Lucien.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ... I tried, sir. I did my best. We all  did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see how it is, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman moves through the ruined palace, around fallen  columns and past broken statues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a sad fact)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of the palace servants turned back  into the dream stuff you made them with --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's back? He's really back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WILD FLAPPING SOUND and a sleek black raven -- MATTHEW  streaks down, hovers in front of Sandman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where have you BEEN? Are you all right?  What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was detained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha. Detained. You haven't changed, that's  good news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nor have you, Matthew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman surveys the devastation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a pisser, ain't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It hurts me, too, lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurts, yes ... Some power returns to me,  simply by being here. But I placed too  much of myself in my tools. And they are  gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits down on a broken marble stair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder ... I wonder if it is all even  worth rebuilding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew speaks an aside to Lucien, not all that quietly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, I wonder if he can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucien shoots Matthew a scolding look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Lord -- some things you should know,  items that need attention right away.  Many of the nightkind are missing. Lesser  dreams. And ...  (he swallows)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the major nightmares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman cocks an eyebrow, waiting. Lucien doesn't like be the messenger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian. Escaped into the waking  world, I'm afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman turns away. Before him is his reflection in a cra mirror, hanging askew on a wall. He looks up into his own eyes a moment, then away -- and in the mirror, we get a  glimpse of a fat, gray face -- DESPAIR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no telling the harm he may have  caused in that time. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I blame myself. Had I been here,  fulfilling my function ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aww ... it wasn't your fault, boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? Then whose? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, in my absence, how much further  havoc has been visited upon the waking  world?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FACES of SLEEPING PEOPLE, as seen on a row of black-and-w video monitors. Cheap public-sector equipment -- out of d out of focus, one of the screens flipping endlessly. Belo each monitor EKGs slowly churn out reams of graph paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DOCTOR moves down the line, checking the readouts with  professional indifference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SCREEN: A man sleeps peacefully -- his name is PAUL - then his legs twitch spasmodically, stop. A piece of mask tape is hand-labeled 'PLMS/nocturnal myoclonus.' NEXT SCR An ELDERLY MAN begins thrashing in bed, SCREAMING, pullin out electrodes. His eyes are open but he sees nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checks his watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patient seventeen, night terror episode  at eleven-oh-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Doctor expects a response, doesn't get it. He turns,  glances down the line -- where an ASSISTANT studies the  length of an EKG read-out, engrossed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: the read-out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gotta be some kind of record. Three  day observation program, and she's never  made it past a level 2 sleep pattern.  Even then just for a few minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Doctor looks interested for the first time, comes ove leaving patient seventeen behind, still SCREAMING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three days without REM sleep? She should  see things crawling the walls by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sign of hallucinations.  She's part of the benzodiazepine study  ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's her name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SCREEN: is a WOMAN, lovely, her face relaxed in the  peaceful beauty of sleep -- but here eyes are wide open,  staring enigmatically INTO CAMERA, unblinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose Walker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROSE WALKER, dressed, quickly packs a few items into an  overnight bag. The Doctor appears in the doorway. He turn envelope in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do appreciate your participation, Miss  Walker. Um, if we could persuade you,  we'd like to have you back for an  individual --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cuts him off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, I know. Lemme guess. I'm  special. You've never seen anything like  me. You want to run blood tests and do a  night-time polysomnogram.  Maybe you'll  do a daytime multiple sleep latency test.  You'll find that my condition is non- respiratory, and not stress induced.  You'll find my eye muscles lack tone  because my REM sleep is so rare, but you  won't know why. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that the check?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose plucks it from his hands. She slings her overnight b over her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, no offense, but ... I've been  monitored and studied and hooked up to  wires since I was ten. If I thought there  was any chance that you guys could get me  a good night's sleep, I'd take you up on  it. But --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shrugs. A wave of the envelope, and she's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The envelope is torn open; Rose examines the check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL -- who we met briefly, a patient in the sleep center has been waiting. He wears a clean denim shirt, and one o those wispy goatees favored by sensitive-artist types.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll get me through another semester.  You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same. Walk you home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul notes the reluctance in her voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Rose ... I'm sorry I ... Sorry  that ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose glances at him from under raised eyebrows, a smile  playing across her lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Paul..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That I couldn't talk to you ... after the  other night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul ... don't worry about it. We just  had some kind of emotional meltdown and  we ended up in bed. It's been known to  happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commuters exit the BART station. Rose and Paul pause, pul skateboards from their bags. They ride expertly downhill, winding in and out of the pedestrians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skateboards in hand, Rose and Paul trudge up a steep hill

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really wasn't looking for, uh, you  know. I was just ... I've been blocked  for so long, and you listen so easy. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was afraid that I'd, I don't know,  seduced you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose laughs. Paul looks hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a grown woman, Paul ... and the whole  tormented artist thing is not nearly as  attractive as tormented artists think it  is. (trying to ease his conscience)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, this was just one of those things.  One of those bells that occasionally  rings ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach the top of the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A trip to the moon on gossamer wings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one of those things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sets her board down, pushes off --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brownstones converted into low-cost apartments. The tenan are young, struggling: students, artists, coffee-house  employees -- sometimes all three at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose arrives at her entrance, Paul close behind. He looks uncomfortable. Rose packs her skateboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey ... let's go have lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry -- I've got too much to deal  with in my life right now. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul looks even more uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking ... just, maybe we should  talk some more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose shoots him a look -- she's had enough. Paul sees it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. The truth of the matter is, I know  all we're going to be is great friends -- (can't help smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But right now, everybody in your whole  building is up with your roommate putting  together a surprise birthday party for  you, and it's up to me to keep you away  from there for the next two hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose is completely shocked. She glances toward her apartm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. Act surprised, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay ...  (back at Paul)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, um ... pals, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul regards her ... they smile. An understanding reached

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pals. For now. (off her look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And probably forever. But I just don't  like saying 'never.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Deal. After all, no one knows their  own destiny, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: The parchment PAGE of massive book. In beautifu illuminated script it reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "After all, no one knows their own destiny, right?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Destiny's Garden, Destiny closed his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: book and went to his gallery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The huge tome is SHUT. It is chained to the wrist of --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DESTINY. Oldest of the Endless. Tall, wearing a hooded  cassock. We are --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destiny moves through his Garden at a measured pace,  assuredly as a blind man in his own familiar home. Perhap is blind, as we do not see his eyes, hidden in shadow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garden is all Greek columns, statues and sweeping  archways. Paths that diverge and branch, fork and divide. Tall hedge mazes immaculately cut --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Destiny knows his way, walking amid the sounds of  silence. He leaves no footprints. And casts no shadow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destiny moves slowly, dwarfed by the high-ceilinged hallw Beyond, chambers lead into many rooms and further chamber He turns a corner, disappears into SHADOW --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six portraits hang on the wall, all painted in romantic  style, all the subjects garbed in eighteenth-century fash

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destiny stops in front of the first painting -- an ornate framed oil portrait of Death, she in an elegant pose. Des speaks, his voice dry as dust:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister. I stand in my Gallery, and I  summon the family to me. It is I, Destiny  of the Endless, who calls you. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death EMERGES from out of her portrait, into the hallway. is her usual sunny self, casually dressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiya, big brother. What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am calling a conclave of the Endless,  Sister. Do you not feel you should be  more appropriately attired?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death pouts ... then spins, and is suddenly wearing a tur the-century satin dress, black leather boots, black silk  gloves. The effect is at once wild and elegant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satisfied?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destiny moves to the next portrait. He does not look at h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I am satisfied. (to the portrait)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sibling, I stand in my Gallery, and I  call you ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DESIRE steps out from the portrait. Perfectly symmetrical perfectly androgynous features. Her (or his) skin is pale smoke, his (or her) eyes tawny and sharp as yellow wine.  Desire smiles in brief flashes, like moonlight glinting f a knife-edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She (or he) is formally dressed: black corset, panties,  garters and stockings. Desire looks around, taking the pl in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dream)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see he hasn't redecorated in the last  three hundred years. So what's the  occasion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destiny will tell us that in his own  time, Desire. He won't be rushed ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DESPAIR emerges from her portrait, a heavy woman, naked,  rolls of fat weighting her down. Grey eyes that narrow to tiny points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see you dressed for the occasion,  Despair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shush. Be nice. It's been years since the  family was together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destiny passes a conspicuous gap where another painting m have hung. The next portrait is of a young girl, smiling, holding flowers in a summer field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister Delirium. Youngest of the Endless.  I stand in my Gallery, and I call you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DELIRIUM steps into the Gallery -- looking not all like h portrait. Orange hair, her fishnet stockings tattered. On eye is vivid emerald green, spattered with silver flecks move; her other eye is vein blue. Who knows what Delirium sees through her mismatched eyes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, sis. How are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: uh. YesterDAY i did SomE really BAD  stuff. I meaN REal bad. YOU know. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: but TOdAY i DiD some GOOD things. I don't  knoW --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hush, little sister. There is one more to  be summoned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the end of the gallery is the portrait of Sandman, dre in the finery of the 17th century. Destiny pauses in fron it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman,  dressed as he was painted, sits at a seven-side table. The Endless gathered around. Destiny stands behind chair. There is one extra chair, standing empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know why I have called this family  meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brother Dream is back. (glances at the empty chair)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you had gone for good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abandoned his realm, abandoned his  responsibilities ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had no choice in the matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DesTiNY couLD hAVe Told yOu WHAT was  ComINg. BUT he wouLdn't 'cAUse he's meAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could not turn that page until it was  time for the turning. But I can tell you  what has occurred in your absence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, do. This could be fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman gestures for Destiny to continue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dreams of men became chaotic. One  man's dream could infect thousands.  Dreams of freedom, of subjugation, dreams  of equality, dreams of death. Dark or  light made no matter, if the dreamer  strong enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delirium pays no attention. Bright butterflies emanate fr her fingertips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i juST made butter-flies. LOOK,  everyBody! LOOk at whaT I just DiD ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brother Dream. You must decide. Will you  repair your kingdom, and return to your  throne?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not sure that I am needed. Or that I  wish to resume my mantle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desire leans forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could make you wish to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Desire, am I not? Where I touch,  things want and need and love, drawn like  butterflies to a candle-flame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean moths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desire's smile widens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butterflies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of Delirium's butterflies lands on a candle flame. It BURNS quickly, writhing, leaving only colored smoke. The  image is at once repellent and beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: thoSe Were MINE. you didn't HaVe to do  thAT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should not argue. We should not fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman looks across the table at Death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have been quiet, sister. What say  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What say I? Well, I'll tell you. And I'm  only going to say it once, so you'd  better pay attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rises and comes around the table to him. He waits

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are utterly the stupidest, most self- centered, appallingest excuse for an  anthropomorphic personification on this  or any other plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits on the table beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What we do aren't just responsibilities.  These aren't just jobs. We didn't answer  ads in the classifieds because we wanted  the health care. Destiny, Desire, Death --  this is what we are. And you -- are  Dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her stern attitude fades, and she takes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you're back. I was worried about  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses his cheek, then moves back to her chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman rubs his forehead ... decides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will repair my kingdom. To do so I must  recover my tools of power: Pouch, Helm,  and Ruby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The path is chosen, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I don't know where they are. Brother,  could you ..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destiny does not respond, but pulls his book closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Of course not. Sisters, can you be of  any assistance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's addressing Desire, Delirium and Despair, who are gro together -- a tableau of Mother, Maiden and Crone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My pouch of sand, which controls dreams.  Do any of you have knowledge of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i kNow! I KNoW! TheRe's a WOman namED  Rachel -- she haS IT! BuT I don'T KNoW  where SHe is. NeiTHeR doeS ShE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delirium shuts her mismatched eyes, furrows her brow. Whe she opens her eyes again, they are both BLUE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel remembers another: Rose Walker.  Perhaps she can lead you to your pouch. (rubs her temples)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It hurts me to be this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delirium's eyes shift back to one green, one blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DesTINy? I'm SORry. I didn't MEaN to calL  you meAn. I mean, i meant to, bUt I  dIdn't MEAN it whEN I meant To.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delirium smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Dreamstone, my Ruby Moonstone, which  can alter the fabric of reality. Where is  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desire seems to enjoy answering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very desirable item, hm? Stolen from a  king by a mage, stolen from a mage by a  thief. And that's the last I know of it. (a knife's-edge smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman scowls. Then turns to Despair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And my helm of office, which protects me  between realms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was traded to a demon long ago. It now  abides in Hell. I am too familiar with  that place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman does not like this news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rises, leaves the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman stands on a balcony looking out over Destiny's  garden. Death joins him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My ruby is missing. And I am not strong  enough to face a single demon, let alone  the hordes of hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So ... the pouch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. My sister, I pray you tell our  siblings that I was needed elsewhere, and  I could not stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her hand, and starts to fade away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adieu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone. Death bites her lip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Now I get to worry about him some  more ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 150-foot white yacht, sleek, huge engines, built for sp and show, a testament to ego rather than seaworthiness.  Anchored far away from shore. Silent and dark, save for  lights in the galley and a forward cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plush and elegant. Long center table, huge refrigerator.  Quiet, cavernous and empty. A door opens --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ALEXANDER BURGESS. No longer the 'young' Burgess, he in his fifties, now -- and looks older. Silk robe pajamas unkempt hair, shuffling along, he is a shocking contrast the opulence of his ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: a tray, as Alexander carefully places five cele sticks in line. Each celery stick is exactly the same len

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander pushes into the cabin, carrying the tray. A hug bed, marble and wood appointments -- this is a yacht Dona Trump might have owned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the bed is the body of a muscular young man. Dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlos ... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander Burgess, I presume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian is standing to one side of the door. Alexa drops the tray, reaches into his robe, draws a gun from a holster at his side --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian moves swiftly, a single blow --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander crumples to the deck, and SCREEN FADES TO BLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FADE UP: CLOSE ON ALEXANDER, lying where he fell. His eye open -- slightly. He shifts his eyes only, glancing aroun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV ALEXANDER -- he sees the Corinthian, moving about the cabin, searching. Photos on the walls show scenes from hu and decadent parties -- liquor, drugs, beautiful women,  powerful men. The Corinthian looks at them, shakes his he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my, such decadence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves past, examines an empty wall. Lingers there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Alexander ... you spent a lot of  time here, didn't you? It stinks of worry  ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances at a trail we can't see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've worn a path. And stood here for  long periods of time ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches up -- a hidden switch behind a bookcase slides back a section of marble, revealing a safe. Without looki

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Alexander)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up! You've been awake for the past  two minutes. Your breathing betrays you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander opens his eyes, struggles to sitting. He begins weep -- not in terror, but in resignation. He wipes his e with both hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew ... it had to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, well ... you shouldn't have written  the book. Led me right to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flings a book off the shelf down in front of Alexander 'LORD MAGUS: The Truths of Roderick Burgess' by Alexander Burgess. Alexander looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid. But I had to ... to ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pay penance? Set the record straight?  Make a fortune off the movie sale?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander laughs mirthlessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardly. You're probably the only one  whose ever read the damn thing. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want me to sign it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ruby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander stands, moves to the safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Carlos dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Your lover?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander works the dial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pilot and body guard. I haven't had much  interest in lovers -- male or female --  in a long time. Although I had my share  of both, once ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls the safe open. It is empty, save for SANDMAN'S R set on a velvet pad. He takes it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This gave them to me. It gave me  everything I ever desired ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mock tragic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except the one thing you ever really  wanted. Your father's love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander makes a fist around the Ruby. Hurls it at the  Corinthian -- who makes an effortless one-handed catch. H holds it up to the light, then pockets it. Draws his knif

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to kill me now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a knife. How prosaic. (a bitter laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bought the yacht for safety. Open  water, supposed to guard against magic  attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father was right, Alexander. You are  an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander winces. The Corinthian moves to Carlos' body, t the corpse's head. He works his knife as he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had the Ruby Moonstone of the King of  Dreams. Reality itself in your sway. And  all you could do was feed your callow  little hungers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up his prize: AN EYEBALL. He lifts it to his fac we think he may eat it. With his free hand, he reaches up remove his sunglasses --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that I take issue with indulging  pleasures ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander gasps at what is revealed behind the Corinthian sunglasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: THE CORINTHIAN'S MOUTH. He brings the eyeball  closer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and past, up, out of frame. EVEN AS HE SPEAKS (CLEARLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you never understood how to truly use  the Stone. You had the power to change  the whole world. And you wasted it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander is stricken. His knees buckle. He slumps to the floor. And then we see what he has seen:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian's eye sockets DO NOT HAVE EYES -- instead, they are both MOUTHS, filled with SHARP TEETH. When he  speaks, all three of his mouths speak -- three voices,  overdubbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's pretty much true of all you  mortals, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He brings his bloody knife up, and advances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (melodramatic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm your worst nightmare. I'm -- (shrugs, smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. Your worst nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He LAUGHS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian, sunglasses back on, pilots the yacht's la across the bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the Ruby from his pocket, holds it up, looking  through it at the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV - THROUGH THE RUBY. Everything is tinted red. And as Corinthian turns the Ruby, its facets distort the city,  distort reality ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON - A DOZEN smiling PARTY-GOERS as they yell --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose's eyes widen, and she looks appropriately surprised; are --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A banner reads 'Happy Birthday, Rose.' The party-goers,  mostly tenants, crowd forward. A cake with one big candle it is proffered; Rose blows it out, pushes through, Paul  behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Among the guests are: KELLY, a chubby young woman with a heart; SAMANTHA, who smokes too many French cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you surprised?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a la Roz Russell)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a cynical old woman now. Nothin'  surprises me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha holds up a little white KITTEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a mercurial change)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh -- oh, look at it! Is it mine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy birthday, Rose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose takes the Kitten, pets it, coos to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you needed something in your  life cute and warm and fuzzy and  demanding, and I didn't know any men, so  ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't sure you'd like it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no ... it's perfect. Purr-fect. I  love it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She needs a name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a she? That's easy. Her name's  'Dinah.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves away, kitten clinging to her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh -- like in Alice in Wonderland. You  know Rose ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other partygoers wish Rose happy birthday, pet the kitty. Rose smiles to everyone, thanking them, moving through th crowd --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tired, Rose collapses into a chair. The kitten burrows be her neck. Someone offers a glass of wine --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul. Rose takes it from him. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So ... can I at least imagine I inspired  you and you were able to get back to  work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish. No, still blocked. I haven't  painted in ... months, is it months?  Shit. And you know about the sleep  trouble. I've been having this weird  dream ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly, questing for snacks, overhears this last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A weird dream? You gotta tell Sam ...  she's a nut for this stuff. Sam, come  here! (Sam joins them)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to tell us a dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ragin'. So tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul hesitates -- it really wasn't for everybody to hear, now he's on the spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dreamt I was climbing a rock face, this  sheer, like, spire --and I hate to climb.  I hate high places in general. I'm an  artist, and I don't even open my windows  to look at the view --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dream ..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. So I'm climbing, and I've reached  the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Paul's dream: A finger of stone pushes its way into pale blue sky. At the pinnacle, Paul maintains a perilous hold, his face white with terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't go higher. I can't climb all the  way back down. And I can't let go. I  can't fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remembering, Paul speaks nervously -- he's genuinely  troubled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just can't. Because if you fall in a  dream, and you hit the ground -- you die.  Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that's just an old wives' tale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tend to trust old wives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So ... ah ... I figure it's about being  blocked. Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds like an anxiety dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It always sounds like an anxiety dream to  you. Unless it's a sex dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if you dream about being anxious  about sex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what you dream about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose is suddenly uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't dream. Never have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean you don't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose takes a drink, looks away, and spots --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANDMAN. Wearing a plain leather jacket, giving the party detached once-over. The guests flow around him, seemingly unaware of his presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Paul)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this spire ... basically long, and  phallic? And you're clinging to it, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curious, Rose moves toward Sandman -- almost drawn to him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, wait a second --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose gazes speculatively at Sandman. She scoops up a Chin fortune cookie from a snack bowl. Steps forward, startlin him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. So are you being lonely or just  aloof?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman glances around for the person she is addressing - then realizes it must be him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You noticed me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah ... it wasn't hard. I looked behind  the philodendron, and there you were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not usually noticed unless I wish to  be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose quickly realizes he's a weirdo, decides to bail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah ... okay, Ninja-boy. Well, have fun  lurking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman catches her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. I require your assistance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My assistance ..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am searching for a possession of mine.  A leather pouch, full of sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose looks afraid. She knows what he's talking about, but wishes she didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pouch ..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman named Rachel stole it. I want it  back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then go get it. And leave me the hell  alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls away from him. She crosses to a window, and cli out, onto the fire escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose nuzzles the kitten. A beat, and then Sandman moves t beside her -- although he did not seem to come out the  window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My sister did not know the woman's  location, nor am I able to sense the  pouch. Do you know where she is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose's words spill out, the venom unmistakable:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel ... is my mother. My mother the  junkie.  She was stoned when I was conceived, she  was stoned when I was born, she was  stoned ... she is always stoned. The  state finally took me away. (more)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear from her once in a while -- when she remembers she maybe had a kid somewhere. (a bitter laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you do know where she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know where she was a year ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take me to her. I will grant you a boon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose stares at him -- this is absurd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A boon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a gift? Like in a fairy tale? That  kind of boon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I am Dream, of the Endless. I am the  Master of Dreams. If it is within my  power, you shall have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose's expression is one of surprise -- but not quite  disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And ... I need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose is skeptical -- but she is considering it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a single, desperate syllable)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose softens -- he is in genuine need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is too weird. My mother ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks down at the fortune cookie in her hand. Looks u Sandman, into his eyes. They gaze at each other a moment, something passes between them. Understanding. Trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose's mouth curls in a sly smile. Cracks the fortune coo extracts the fortune. Reads it. Shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading the fortune)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Be open to new experiences.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks again at Sandman. Sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. We really don't get to choose  these things, do we? I'll take you there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman nods gratefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that doesn't mean I believe you. What  a line. The Master of Dreams. Yeah,  right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very bad neighborhood. A taxi screeches away from the c Sandman stands on the sidewalk, Rose beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is one step above condemned. Tall brown weeds a broken windows, flaking paint and decaying siding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pouch is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose steps up to the house, rings the bell. Checks the fr door. Locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can go around back and break a window  or something --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We go in by the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman gestures. A CLICK is heard, and the door opens  slightly. Rose looks at Sandman in astonishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me you did that. That was  chance, right? Because if you did that

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman gestures for her to enter. She pushes the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door moves open slowly, pushing a large pile of mail  before it -- magazines, letters, bills. Rose enters, frow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six months worth of mail ...  (calling, panicked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohmigod. Rachel? MOTHER?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves toward a stairway. Sandman stops her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
