dialogues.text: Rose. This place is not safe for you.  Things are free in this house that should  not be loose on earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at him blankly, not really hearing him. She pu away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give me any more of that crap. She  might be in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and is off, up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose slows her ascent. Before her, white CLOUDS obscure t second floor, tendrils of MIST curling down the stairway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Resolved, she steps into the mist. Looks down --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VERTIGO hits us as the clouds part. Below Rose is open sk the city thousands of feet below. Rose FALLS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WHITE NOISE sound of WIND as Rose free-falls, plummet toward earth. Arms and legs spread, she watches, wide-eye the ground approaches. She SCREAMS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SCREEN CRACKS LIKE A MIRROR. Pieces of it fall away. stands on a misty plane. Color, sound, creatures and word whirl around her violently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is DELIRIUM'S REALM. Delirium looks up at Rose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HavE yOu COme to viSIT my ReaLM?  GoodGooDGooDie. I Like comPAnY ... (more)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i LikE to be ALoNE, too. but NOt bY MYseLf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman's hand touches Rose's shoulder. He stands beside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister ... she is not yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRother! nOW we cAn aLL bE aLONe ThrEE at  A tiMe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, little one. Not now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delirium makes a face. Blows a lock of hair out of her fa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um. OkaY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clouds, mist, and realm are gone. Sandman stands behi Rose, close to her, holding her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose. You're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose, shaking, hangs onto Sandman. Takes in her surroundi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh. ... so real. I thought I saw ... You  were there. A dream -- like Paul's. It  was only a dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is never 'only a dream,' Rose. Here  less than some other places.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes open a door. The hallway beyond is black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow, if you must.  (offhand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful. Stay away from the mouths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean stay away from the -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he has already entered the hallway. She follows --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scrape-whoosh of a cigarette lighter. Rose holds the  flame aloft, gasps --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flame lights a hellish scene: The walls are not smoot DOZENS of grotesque, blood red FACES bulge from the walls ceiling. Thin tentacle arms reach out, hands gripping han from the other side, blocking their path. The faces SNEER several speaking at once:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave her.  Do not disturb. She is ours. We from hungry. Do not disturb us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose shrinks back, looks around wildly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she? Mother!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The faces gnash teeth, lick drooling lips. They flow alon the wall, some fading back, others pushing forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foolish foolish. Hear it posture? Hear it threaten? Foolish meat things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let us through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman's voice has instant effect. Some faces look  surprised; others glance around warily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who said? Who spoke? Not him. He's gone. All gone long gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has gone far enough. You have  exceeded your bounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The faces are already pulling back into the walls. Eyes  lowered, contrite. A few are even scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master? Do not chastise. Sorry sorry. We thought you long gone. Yes yes Master.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman moves down the hall, the arms untangling before h A disgusting meaty wet PLOP sound as the arms pull back i the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose stares as the hallway becomes smooth, normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dreams, right? Those were dreams. And you  really are their Master.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you send them? Are you responsible  for this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman pushes open the door at the end of the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dimly lit. The SOUND of buzzing FLIES. Rachel's naked bod lies sprawled, partially covered by a sheet, her appearan shock: her skin is shriveled and decayed, several months  beyond death. Her eyes are open, unseeing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose moves forward, recoils at the sight of her mother. S drops to one knee, sobbing at the foot of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Rachel, as her eyes flutter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose's eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no she's alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's there? Oh! (a ghastly smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dreamt I had a daughter, once. Such a  wonderful dream ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel sits up. The sheet falls away from her shoulders. wish it hadn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dream dream dreeeeam ... Whenever I want  to ... all I have to do is dreeeeeam ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pouch of sand lies on a night stand. Sandman picks it Squeezes it tight in his fist. He has reclaimed his first tool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No that's mine. Mine. Gimme ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel lurches for the pouch -- Sandman simply takes a st back. She collapses face-first on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Rose)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have the pouch. We can go now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose stares at him in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  You can't just take what you wanted  and go. You can't leave her like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman regards Rachel, who writhes in the bed, humming, dry, croaking sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? The sand was the only thing  keeping her alive. She will die soon. (an afterthought)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Painfully, I would imagine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves to the bedroom door. Rose stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I request my boon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For helping you. The boon you promised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman turns, eyes her -- an almost menacing look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give her a ... merciful release from  this. Please. You can do that, can't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman is surprised. His look softens. He reassesses her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could choose anything in the world.  And you choose to help her. Her, of all  people. (more)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am ... impressed, Rose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She meets his gaze. Again, that connection between them. nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will grant your desire, Rose. You must  leave the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose closes her eyes. Opens them, looks on her mother one last time. Turns, moves past Sandman, directly out the  bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Sandman's hand, as he sprinkles dream sand from fingers. It falls --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- turning into PETALS that land on Rachel's forehead. Sh somehow young and healthy, now, lying back on green grass More petals land. Rachel opens her eyes, smiles. We are:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is shining. A young girl -- it must be Rose, as a child -- GIGGLES as she drops petals onto her sleeping  mother. Rachel stands, alive and healthy. She laughs, sta to spin, arms flung outward. Rose spins with her, twirlin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel lies on the sheets, dead. Sandman pulls the covers over her eyes. Pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Death leans into frame. She smiles sympathetical whispers into Sandman's ear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a lovely final dream you gave  her, little brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leans out. There is the soft fluttering SOUND of WING Then silence. Sandman is alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose waits. The bedroom door opens, and Sandman is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She died peacefully. She died happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Great. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman backs away from her. Rose sighs, looks up at him The hallway is empty. Sandman is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police cars and an ambulance crowd the street in front of Rachel's house. The ambulance (presumably with Rachel's b pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bystanders stand behind police tape. Rose sits in the bac a taxi. She gazes up at the house, lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Mister Sandman, bring me a dream ...  make him the cutest ... that I've ever  seen ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The taxi pulls forward, moves down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several piles of GLITTERING cut DIAMONDS are strewn on a  workbench. They sparkle in the glow of the overhead light

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hulking FAT MAN lays out jeweler's tools on a blue velv cloth. Babyish face, his hands seem dainty and too-small his huge arms, his features tiny, lost in the mounds of f He calls himself FUNLAND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a RAP on the metal side door. Funland moves quic expectantly. Pulls the door open. The Corinthian stands i the doorway. Extends his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funland, isn't it? Hi. The Corinthian. We  met online.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right ... wow, I can't believe it's  actually you ... wow. I thought you'd be  older --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My compliments to you on your BBS. Well  done.  (looks beyond him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we're all set, then? The tools?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I, uh, got your e-mail --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian sits at the workbench. Sandman's RUBY is i small vice; the Corinthian peers at it through a magnifyi light, measuring the stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funland eats a whole Twinkie, washes it down with a swig Jolt Cola. He looks over the Corinthian's shoulder. Tryin act nonchalant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little proud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I've got my own little thing  going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've found my own special place. There's,  like, thousands of people. And there are  always beautiful little children  wandering off, getting lost. Always  pleased to see somebody friendly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian murmurs as he makes an adjustment at the  bench. He pulls out a page torn from a book, consults it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And quiet places to take them to, even in  the middle of the crowds. And what's  great is, the people who run the place  always hush it up. They don't want anyone  to know that I'm there either. They want  everybody to be happy. Just like me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian CUTS, fashioning the gem into a NEW SHAPE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dreamy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a wonderful place, my secret,  special place. And the other thing I  love, if you can't find any beautiful  children to play with, you can always go  on one of the rides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without looking up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How very pleasant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I can't tell anyone else where it  is, because, y'know, they'd all want to  go there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian lifts the Ruby, examines it. Puts it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to make use of your mailing  list, Funland. There's going to be a  gathering of collectors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- really? Uh, sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funland moves to an old Mac Plus computer on the bench,  hunches in front of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nimrod is organizing it. Send him the  addresses you have. And I have some names  to add: Family Man. Carrion. Moon River.  Dog Soup. Candy Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bright SHARDS of ruby chip off as the Corinthian works, h the table, the floor -- and flatten into drops of BLOOD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amazed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dog Soup and Candy Man? Oh, man. Oh, wow  ... this'll be great ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funland's fingers dance over the keyboard. A bloody shard flies out from the Ruby, hits Funland on the cheek. He  touches it. Looks at his finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that's ... that's ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (helpful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood. Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funland stares at his finger, the blood drops coming from ruby. Quickly turns away, back to the keyboard. The  Corinthian laughs, keeps working ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucien sifts through piles of fallen books, carefully pla them in order back onto the shelves. A PUMPKINHEAD MAN  silently assists him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew flutters in, perches on a stack of books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, the library's open again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Lord Dream was good enough to  restore it before ... before he continued  with his tasks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he's gone to hell, huh? To get his  helm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew shudders. He glances around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never got into the whole book thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, but it's a very unusual library,  Matthew. (with pride)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somewhere in here is every story that has  ever been dreamed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Say, watch this. (sticks his beak into Lucien's face)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEVERMORE! Good, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmn. The complete Poe is in the southern  annex. Including stories he never wrote,  or never finished, except in dreams --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon! I was doing Peter Lorre in that  Roger Corman movie -- (he cocks his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Lucien. Is that big black thing  supposed to be there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks where Matthew is looking --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In one wall is a large hole. Nothing beyond but blackness Even as they watch, the hole enlarges, shelves and books  DISSOLVING as the widening edge touches them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, dear!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew flutters backwards, away from the black hole. Luc reaches forward, pulls volumes off the shelf nearest the  hole, saving them from obliteration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does this mean ... the boss isn't doing  so well in Hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- it's a Dream Vortex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, oh. That's bad. That's very bad. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a Dream Vortex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucien's arms are stacked with books by now. He adds more others fall, backing away from the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something that can destroy the entire  Dreaming ... the Waking World ... even  Lord Dream himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheesh ... when it rains, it pours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucien and Matthew retreat across the room, through a doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SLAM! as the door shuts. Lucien's books fall to the flo as he leans with his back to the door, as if trying to ke the Vortex locked inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Master must be informed as soon as he  returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew ... sometimes you can be very  infuriating. (beat; quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he returns ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman stands outside the gates. A gesture, and an  anci wooden pier grows from nowhere. It rests on rough-hewn  pylons, floating in a sea of stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman now stands at the edge of the pier, looking down. steps off the edge, drops--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman falls, lands on a barren landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before him is Hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Walls of Hell are constructed of human bodies, piled to the sky. Dead bodies, we presume, until here an eye op there a chest heaves in sigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gates of Hell are wrought-iron-style ornate, intricat glorious -- but fashioned of living bodies, horribly  distended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Near the Gates a severed HEAD has been impaled on a spike The head twists toward Sandman, grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah! There is one at the door! (rhyming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's one at the door, at the gates of  Damnation. Is it thief, thug or whore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greetings. I wish to talk to your master.  Immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's one at the door, and there's room  for one more, 'till the end of creation!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the King of Dreams, of the Nightmare  Realms. I seek Lord Lucifer, the Lord of  Hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taunting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes, my clown. So where's your crown?  Where's you're ruby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman unexpectedly lashes out with his fist, slugging t head. It spins on its spike -- a comic image if it weren' grotesque.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will take no insults from you, little  demon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Head grins through bloody lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squatterbloat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A minor demon -- SQUATTERBLOAT -- pushes open the Gates o Hell. The demon is hunched over, with no mouth; one of it arms ends in the shape of a sharp battle-ax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the Dreamclown. Guard him and guide  him, he's new in town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squatterbloat nods. Steps back, lifts the battle-ax arm,  indicating the way. Sandman moves through the gates --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman follows behind Squatterbloat, takes in Hell as it flows past. They move through a forest of thin, sickly- looking trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wood of suicides has changed since my  last visit. I remember it as a tiny  grove. Now it is a forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squatterbloat remains silent, continues on ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman is led past a row of barred caves. He brushes pas hands that clutch at him. Anguished voices cry out. Sandm tilts his head, hearing something. He raises a hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The demon Squatterbloat pauses. Sandman peers through the bars into one of the caves --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside, Roderick Burgess is chained to a wall, his own ar wrapped several times around his body, forming a flesh  straight jacket. He confides to a fellow prisoner, simila constrained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (boasting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put my curse on a man and he was dead.  I captured Dream! Oh, I was the most  wicked man to ever live --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roderick Burgess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burgess looks out, recognizes Sandman. He is stricken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You call yourself wicked, without knowing  what that means. You dream you are the  equal of the demons around you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burgess's mouth drops open, but he has no words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANDMAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burgess, for your deeds against me, this  is my judgment on you. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shall know who you truly are. I take  away your dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burgess frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Special? Of course! I'm Roderick Burgess!  I'm the ...  (falters)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is, I'm the ... uh ... I'm ... just
(beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: uh, me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes widen. He takes in his surroundings, as if notin his situation for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, Sandman gestures to move on. Squatterbloat leads way. From behind them come Burgess's screams --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God no. Help, somebody help me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squatterbloat stops at the foot of a stairway. Blood flow down the steps. Sandman glances up, climbs --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the summit, the steps end at a high parapet, at Lucife throne. Made of flesh, the throne bleeds, source of the  flowing blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucifer leans casually against a railing. He is blond, le youthful, a handsome rock star lounging in the shadow of own enormous black wings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greetings to you, Lucifer Morningstar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucifer looks Sandman up and down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Dream. We heard you were caught by  mortals, like a newly-fledged demon. We  expected better of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman does not comment. Lucifer hops up on the balcony, leans forward expectantly, chin on the back of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you come to ally your realm to ours?  To acknowledge the sovereignty of Hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know my views on that, Lightbringer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we do. Still this is no social call.  What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My helm was stolen from me. I believe one  of your demons has it. I would like it  back. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucifer is amused. He arranges his dark wings about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which demon? There are more than a  million demons, after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not know the demon's name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Lucifer, as his eyes narrow. His tone changes - this is serious business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let us summon all of them to tell,  and meet them on the Vasty plains of  Hell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK: from Lucifer's eyes. He and Sandman have not  moved, but everything around them has changed. The parape crowded with demons, claws scraping, eyes glinting --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUE PULLING BACK: the stairway is covered with demon all types and sizes. Some are insects. Others look like  reptiles. Some wear their guts outside their skins --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUE PULLING BACK: More and more demons, crawling ove each other, biting, fighting --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of the demons of Hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucifer and Sandman are tiny dots, standing on a distant  mesa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. Now, Dream King. Tell us ... which  demon has your helm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman scans the multitude. He reaches into his Pouch, p out a handful of sand. Releases it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LINE of DREAM SAND streaks into the demons. It shoots t way and that, searching, creatures flying past in a blur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally the sand SWIRLS, settles on: CHORONZON, a blood-r demon, fashionably dressed. He looks surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Choronzon, a Duke of Hell. (to the demon)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well? Does Dream speak truly? Do you  indeed have his mask of office?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Choronzon has two mouths on his face, one above the other one speaks, the other smirks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Return it to me. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both of Choronzon's mouths smile, a double dose of insole grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ssss. I traded for it from a mortal. A  fair trade. (bold)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I broke none of the laws of Hell.  If you want your precious back then you  must fight me for it. Ssss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Demons HOWL and JEER at the challenge. Lucifer is amused. Dream regards the utterly confident Choronzon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well. I challenge you, Choronzon. We  shall play the most ancient game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sss. Sso. As the challenged, I choose the  battlefield. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I assert ... Reality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dingy nightclub. Demons sit at small tables placed too  close together, near a dingy stage. Lucifer watches from seat in the shadows, not touching the drink in front of h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lighting is hellish, of course. Choronzon is our host wears a tuxedo and dark glasses, speaks glibly into the m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sss. Welcome, ladies 'n' gennelmen, to  another thrill packed evening of  funfunfun here at the Hellfire Club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APPLAUSE from the assembled demons. A female demon -- a  voluptuous body and the head of a horse -- snorts and sto her hooves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am your host, Choronzon, High Duke of  the Eighth Circle. Tonight, for your  entertainment, a formal challenge. Let's  have a big hand for Mister Sandman!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLINDING SPOTLIGHT hits Sandman, standing center stage. Scattered APPLAUSE from the demons, amid mostly BOOS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Choronzon moves opposite to Sandman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadly serious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the rules, Dreamlord? Win, and  you get your helm. Lose, and you serve as  a ssslave of Hell, for eternity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman stares into Choronzon's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have the first move. (loudly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am a dire wolf, prey stalking, lethal  prowler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a quick FLASH we see Choronzon's wolf, a hulking creat stalking through a forest. Sandman is quick to reply:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am a hunter, horse-mounted, wolf- stabbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We catch a GLIMPSE of Sandman's hunter, on horseback, as hunter kills the wolf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confident)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am a horsefly, horse-stinging, hunter- throwing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Choronzon's slain wolf becomes a stinging fly, and Sandma hunter is thrown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Demons cheer. At one table, a TOOTHY DEMON picks the fles off another's face, eats it -- washes it down with beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am a spider, fly-consuming, eight- legged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman's hunter TRANSFORMS into a spider. Choronzon's fl caught in a web.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hisses)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am a snake, spider-devouring, poison- toothed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Choronzon's fly becomes a snake; it eats Sandman's spider

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am an ox, snake-crushing, heavy footed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The snake is crushed beneath the hoof of an ox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am an anthrax, butcher bacterium, warm- life destroying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The demons like that. The Toothy Demon has nearly finishe his snack -- the other demon's skull is nearly picked cle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman's ox lies on its side, dead and decaying. Sandman pauses a moment, considering. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am a world, space-floating, life  nurturing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a GREEN WORLD, floating in space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucifer tilts his head, noting Sandman's shift in strateg Choronzon does not hesitate:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am a nova, all-exploding, planet  cremating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE LIGHT from a bright nova OBLITERATES the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the universe -- all things  encompassing, all life embracing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Choronzon leans toward Sandman. His top and bottom mouths alternate on each word now, his tone low and deadly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the dark at the end of everything.  The end of universes, Gods, worlds ... of  everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman pauses. The assembled demons grin, lean forward,  pleased with the move. Several of the closer demons lick  their fangs. Choronzon senses victory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sss. And what will you be then,  Dreamlord?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman speaks softly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucifer's brow furrows. Choronzon is caught off guard. Al eyes are on him. He stammers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Then I am ... sss. I ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to sweat. He looks around for help, inspiration

dialogues.speaker: I ...
dialogues.text: (he swallows)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ... don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucifer stands, a look of hate and disgust on his face --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucifer and Sandman stand on a flat plain, demons forming wide circle around them. Choronzon, bound in barbed wire, writhes and SCREAMS for mercy. Two demons hold him tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take this pathetic creature from our  sight. Demonstrate to him our  displeasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The demons pull Choronzon away. Lucifer turns -- he holds Sandman's helm in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, Dream Master. Your helm. You have  won it fairly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman takes the helm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. The king of Hell is honorable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honorable? You joke, surely. Look around  you. (he sweeps his arm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The million Lords of Hell stand arrayed  about you. Tell us -- why we should let  you leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman looks. Legions of demons stare back, shout words hate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helm or no, you have no power here. What  power have dreams in Hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say that dreams have no power here?  Tell me, Lucifer Morningstar ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His voice grows stronger; he raises it to include the res

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask yourselves, all of you ... What is  Hell, without the dream of Heaven?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucifer has no answer. Sandman turns away from him, walks into the mass of demons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noiselessly, demons move aside, parting before Sandman,  unable to meet his gaze. His back to Lucifer, Sandman  dwindles into the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to include Lucifer in frame, seemingly huge now hundreds of feet tall. He watches Sandman take leave of H

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One day ... one day we shall destroy him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gates shut heavily behind Sandman --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slumps; his posture more exhausted than imperial. He l at his hands, one holding his pouch, the other his helm. hands are shaking. He smiles a grim little smile -- he ha gotten away with his bluff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He concentrates, and darkness swirls up, surrounding him, obscuring the Gates of Hell --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew and Lucien sit in the hallway, amongst stacks of  books. The Pumpkinhead now wears a hard-hat, and is setti up construction warning sawhorses outside the Library doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So if his nibs and the Dreaming are  destroyed ... that's it for us too, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has appeared beside them, startling them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geez -- I hate when you do that! (re: the helm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad to see you survived your trip.  Welcome back. We're all doomed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed ..? Lucien?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fear he's right, my lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Rose, sleeping, a troubled sleep. Her eyes open and she glances over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonlight through the window cuts across the darkened roo Rose's closet door is cracked open, just a little bit. Ju enough to drive you crazy wondering what might be in ther

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose climbs out of bed. Steps across to the closet. Shuts door. Turns, gets back into bed. She glances over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The closet door still hangs open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose stares. She gets up. Approaches the closet, much mor warily this time. Reaches out. Gently pulls it open --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG WOMAN stands there, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose jumps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The smiling woman does not move. We may recognize her,  because it is RACHEL, Rose's mother. But not the Rachel w last saw stoned on dreamsand. A youthful Rachel, as we fi met her with Burgess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel's face falls. Her gaze lowers, unhappy at not bein recognized. Then she looks up, raises a hand, and PULLS O

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- revealing another head beneath: Rachel, as we last saw lying in bed, wrinkled, decrepit. Rose gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother. My God. This is a dream. I'm  actually having a dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel reaches up again, and again PULLS OFF HER HEAD.  Revealed beneath this one is another version of how she  looked as a young woman. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard about this ... a dream where  somebody who's died comes back, to let  you know they're all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel shakes her head. Gestures for Rose to follow her. steps aside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the closet is no longer a closet. It opens onto a  courtyard, moonlit, stark, high-contrast black-and-white. little phony-looking, actually, like an old B-movie horro film set. Amazing how scary those old sets can look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel again gestures, turns, glides into the courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose moves through corridors and around corners, followin Rachel, getting just glimpses of her, always just one ste behind ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big wide convertible pulls to a stop. The driver climbs -- it's the Corinthian. He heads inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The library doors swing open. Sandman, Lucien and Matthew look out at --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HUGE, SWIRLING VORTEX. There is no library -- a whole  section of the palace has been consumed. Parts of the  landscape are pulled into the vortex as they watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it begins once more. The first vortex  of this era. (musing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nonetheless, there is something about  this one -- this time -- that I don't  understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That makes two of us. Though I don't  think I would've understood it any time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has been growing for nearly two  decades.  Had I not been imprisoned, I would have  dealt with it at the time of its  conception.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps this is how the Corinthian  escaped ... he found a rift in the  Dreaming, and slipped out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm ... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The recovery of my Ruby must wait. I must  deal with the Vortex, first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How will you locate it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, boy ... that's gonna be a toughie. (as if seeing the Vortex for  the first time)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! There it is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's merely the manifestation of the  Vortex, Matthew. The Vortex itself is  usually a mortal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A person? How does he deal with it, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How? He terminates their existence,  Matthew. To protect the dreaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Makes me feel kinda sorry for him.  The mortal, that is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Vortex is not a he. It is a she.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points - DIRECTLY AT THE CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you look closely you will see her  observing us, now, from the corner of the  throne room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew flutters over, STARES AT US. We realize this whol scene has been a POV SHOT (from Rose's POV). The effect i quite disconcerting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tilting his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. She doesn't look like much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA BACKS AWAY, indicating the POV character's retreat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks quite young.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say the Boss can take her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLUR as the CAMERA PANS AWAY --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose comes awake even as she is shoving herself backwards out of the bed and onto the floor, startling her kitten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets her bearings. Rubs her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, that sucked. I don't think I need  to dream after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unfortunately that is not true for the  rest of the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose looks up. SANDMAN steps out of the shadows -- or did just appear from them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God! Stay away from me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She scrambles for her nightstand drawer, pulls out a .38  revolver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay back! I should have known you were  some kind of freak! How did you get in  here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does. Sandman looks down. At his feet, the kitten mew He picks it up, scratches its ears absently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once in every era, Rose Walker, there is  a Vortex. The Vortex, by its nature,  destroys the barriers between dreaming  minds; destroys the ordered chaos of the  Dreaming ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has nothing to do with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until the myriad dreamers are one. Then  the Vortex collapses in upon itself. And  then it is gone. It takes the minds of  the dreamers with it; damages the  Dreaming beyond repair. It leaves nothing  but darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kitten has grown tired of the attention; it squirms.  Sandman sets it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is one of my functions to prevent this  from occurring again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It happened once ... A world was lost,  Rose Walker. Aeons ago, and half a  universe away. I ... failed in my duty. A  whole world perished. (downcast)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will never happen again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kitten comes to Rose. She lets it crawl into her arms but she doesn't lower the gun. She almost speaks to the  kitten:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was your father, Rose Walker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father? I don't know. My mother never  ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father was a dream. A dream your  mother conjured, from my pouch of sand.  You were born of the union of a mortal  and a dream. You are both, and neither,  and by being -- and not being -- such,  you have become the Vortex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if you're the King of Dreams -- can't  you just, I don't know, wave your hand  and make it stop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not omnipotent. No matter how  strange the circumstances of your birth,  you are of the living. You are the  Vortex. Only when the Vortex is dead is  the Dreaming safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves nearer, crouches to be closer to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death is not always a bad thing, Rose ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well, you first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could come and stay in the  dreamworld. Some mortals are given that  option. My raven, Matthew, was once a  mortal man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ... I am sorry, Rose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you are. You are the sorriest excuse  for a murderer I've ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian stands in the doorway. Rose raises her gun back up, aims it at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What -- who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corinthian. Do not interfere with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, he knows me. He created me. And now  I've come to challenge him. It's just the  same old story, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves across the room, to Rose. She keeps the gun stea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CORINTHIAN (Cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But here's a cool twist: I'm here to save  you! (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't let you stay alive, you know.  The dreaming will fall apart. It's  already happening. I can feel it. (to Sandman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This woman is now under my protection.  Got that? Leave her be, or suffer the  consequences.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corinthian. I did not think it possible  for you to surprise me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've walked the waking world for almost  two decades now. As much as I've taught  these humans, I've also learned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up the Ruby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For instance: One shouldn't limit one's  ambition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ruby is mine, little dream. I  command you return it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian considers. His voice resonates with sarcas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have I not earned the praise of my  creator? Look what I have done. Look what  I have found. For you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is not in your nature to be  beneficent.  (holds out his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not force me to unmake you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hokay. Your call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses the Ruby to Sandman, who catches it. Sandman ho it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At last --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ruby GLOWS, throwing off ELDRITCH FIRE--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman SCREAMS. The ruby drops from his hand. Sandman dr to his knees, face wracked with pain. He doubles over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... you have ... changed it ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. It's mine now. The power behind  it may be yours, but I'm the one who  calls the shots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up the Ruby, aims it at Sandman. Considers. Then kicks Sandman hard in the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. Was that more in my nature?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got the gun leveled at the Corinthian. He looks at The Ruby glows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instead of the gun, Rose is now holding the kitten in a t handed grip. It YOWLS. She drops it in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian holds out his hand to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now ... come with me if you want to live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose looks at Sandman, then back at the Corinthian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ... don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose. You must come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, see, it's not a request.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He PUNCHES the side of her head, hard. She pitches forwar The Corinthian catches her in a fireman's carry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistling a monotonous tune, the Corinthian dumps Rose in the convertible, hops in, and ROARS off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flying along low over green rolling hills. Pacific Coast  Highway is a winding ribbon below. Ahead we see a plain t story hotel on the ocean side of the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tall sign in front looms up; it reads: WELCOME CEREAL CONVENTION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A typical convention floor: dealer tables are laid out wi videos, books, posters for sale. Poorly lit. Far more men than women. We pick up snatches of conversation, almost  documentary-style. A DEALER and CUSTOMER chat:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the TV version? The TV version  butchered it! But I hear you can get it  uncut on video in Canada --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TIRED MAN gets a drink from a vending machine:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hate these little hick towns. Wouldn't be  seen dead here, if it weren't for the  convention --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two BUYERS examine the liner notes of an old LP record al

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He slays me. You heard him do the  'I am John's coathanger routine?'  Hilarious --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man strides through the lobby; he carries a clipboard,  wears square eyeglasses and a worried expression. His  carefully hand-lettered name tag reads: NIMROD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes to the registration table. Funland runs it, the  metal folding chair straining under his massive bulk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we have the Corinthian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funland flips through index cards in a tiny metal box. He wears a little black skull cap with little black cat ears it that once may have been little black mouse ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hasn't checked in here yet. But don't  worry -- I'm sure he's coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't not come. He's our guest of  honor. Have we got any other big names so  far?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funland's thick fingers flip through the cards again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um. Moon River, but he seemed kind of  shy. And the Candyman, you know, the one  from Connecticut. The guy with the candy- canes. Umn, the Lip Collector is here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many so far?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighty people have registered. Pretty  good turnout, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighty? Jesus. Didn't think so many would  show --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nimrod, a little nervous, stands at a lectern, looking ou over a sea of faces. All types: young, old, professional, blue color. Very few women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, uh, heard a story recently I thought  might amuse you. It seems that the  telephone rang in a police station. The  duty cop answers and a woman's voice  says, "Help -- I've been reaped!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nimrod takes a breath -- he's a terrible storyteller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says, "Don't you mean raped?" "No, she  says. "He used a scythe."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A half-second of endless pause while the punchline sinks then there is an explosion of laughter. Nimrod visibly  relaxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really good to see so many of us  here. So many. This is the first of these  cons, and if you want to see another,  there are a couple rules we must adhere  to. (raises a finger)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Firstly, use your preferred sobriquet. No  civilian names.  (raises two fingers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secondly, we don't shit where we eat.  Nobody does any collecting until the  convention's over and you're at least two  hundred miles away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This rule must be followed, with so many  of us at risk. (more)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've reserved the entire hotel; there are no other guests, so you shouldn't be tempted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few good-natured laughs at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. Don't miss the keynote address --  it's at eight, and it's from the  Corinthian, the man who's inspired so  many of us --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sudden BURST of APPLAUSE. A few people stand. Hoots of  approval. There's no doubt who everyone is here to see.  Nimrod backs away, a little shocked, but he smiles --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Cereal Con '98!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A distinguished man -- THE GOOD DOCTOR -- sits at the  counter, sipping coffee and examining a flyer. Next to hi PHILIP (aka THE BOGEYMAN). Young, wild hair, wrinkled jac he stares sideways at the Doctor in awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, but I've seen you before,  haven't I? You're that doctor. To think  you're a -- a collector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. You are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the Bogeyman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard of you. The newspapers, in  their facile way, have also christened me  Flay-by-Night.  (out of nowhere)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventy nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Give me a number." That's your line,  isn't it? Seventy nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Philip, as his expression becomes dreamy while h remembers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, right. She was, like, she had  these beautiful eyes, like patches of sky  early in the morning, and she screamed  like an angel ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman catches Philip's eye -- her nametag identifies he DOG SOUP. Philip is amazed, eyes glued as she passes by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dog Soup is a woman? Oh, man. I gotta go  talk to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bounds out of his chair, dashes to go catch the woman. GOOD DOCTOR frowns, follows Philip with his eyes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big, long, mean-lookin' convertible pulls up in front o the hotel. The Corinthian leaps over the door before the  valet can get to it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian lifts the wide lid of the rear trunk. Look big enough in there for a family of five, but right now  there's just one LARGE OLD SUITCASE TRUNK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM! The trunk hits the pavement. BAM! The rear lid slams down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: bam!-bam!-bam!-bam! As the Corinthian pulls the trunk beh him up the concrete steps, into the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CORINTHIAN'S POV as we move through the lobby. Smiles and waves from people as they pass by. The Corinthian's name whispered and people point -- it's a rock star's entrance creating quite the stir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funland has a packet waiting -- he extends it as the  Corinthian arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's you stuff, Mr. Corinthian. Uhn,  wear your badge at all times. You won't  be permitted into the convention areas  without it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian looks delighted at the materials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly! Thank you, Funland. You're  doing a fine job!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funland glances curiously at the trunk as the Corinthian  wheels it toward the elevator. Philip appears at the  Corinthian's side, out of nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Mister Nimrod said you'd be coming,  but... Um, we're all big fans of yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so glad you could come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doors part. The Good Doctor is in the elevator. Philip  follows the Corinthian inside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Good Doctor keeps an eye on Philip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, you ever read a magazine called  CHASTE? It's really terrific.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  (digs out a rolled-up copy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, can I have your autograph --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up one level, the doors part --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nimrod!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the Corinthian hurries out of the elevator, drops the tru THUD! -- puts an arm around Nimrod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're here. Good. The convention hall is  set up, but we still need to discuss the  exact numbers for the banquet --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip follows the Corinthian out, but he has been left  behind, forgotten. The Good Doctor stays in the elevator. doors close on his dark expression --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A panel discussion in progress. A wild-eyed man with a  flowing gray beard holds the mic tightly, hoarding it fro the other two guests, who look pissed. The name card in f of him reads DELIVERANCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am a merciful God and a just God. For I  release men and women and children from  the suffering and torment of their lives,  and I give them a new life in my heaven!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slams his fist down, rants on. Philip is in the audien watching, rapt. He is startled when someone whispers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bogeyman, can we talk? In your room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Philip turns, sees Nimrod, who wears a friendly smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhn, well, I'm watching the religion  panel, man, but ... uh, sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door SLAMS open. Philip is shoved into the room hard; stumbles, falls to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, you guys -- oh God -- listen,  what is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Philip has seen the Good Doctor, standing silently in the shadows of the room.  Next to him is the LIP COLLECTOR -- tall, gangly man with a gaunt face and toothy grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the Bogeyman. Really I am. (soft)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a number. Any number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nimrod goes through Philip's wallet. The Good Doctor pick a copy of CHASTE magazine, casually flips through it. The Collector hangs in the background, still grinning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your name is Philip Sitz. You're the  editor, writer, whatever, of Chaste  magazine. Your number's up, Philip. You  aren't one of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- no, I am. I understand it. Females  are insects created for male pleasure.  Strength. Energy. Lust. The willingness  to sacrifice another's life for one's own  gratification ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He collapses, lowers his head, kneeling before them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand it. That's why I had to get  here. To see you all. To learn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big mistake, Philip. Big mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Good Doctor swings a metal suitcase stand at Philip's head. Philip sprawls to the ground. The Good Doctor and  Nimrod stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "We don't shit where we eat," Mr. Nimrod?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except when we have to, Doctor. Needs  must, when the devil drives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the bathroom, we hear the SOUND of the SHOWER RUNNIN The Corinthian in there, whistling happily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The large old trunk sits on the bed. A loud THUMP, and it jiggles, shaking the bed. Something's inside. Another THU and it moves closer to the edge. It's pretty comic, actua A final THUMP --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trunk tilts over the edge of the bed, falls, clasp-si down. It splits open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A foot appears, then a leg. Rose struggles out from under trunk. Her hands are tied behind her back, and she is gag She looks toward the bathroom fearfully, bolts for the do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose staggers down the hallway, her legs buckling beneath her. She's frightened, disoriented. She pushes her face  against the wall, scrapes at the gag, rolling it, getting out of her mouth. Above her is a hand-lettered sign: 4:30 panel discussion: MAKE IT PAY. VOICES come from inside:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A panel discussion in progress, the participants' names o cards in front of them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... even ten G's per victim identified  isn't too much to ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. The thing to remember is that  they'll pay to know for certain. Even if  the cops don't go with it, the families  will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Carrion, we don't do it for the  money --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is some commotion at the back of the room. Heads tu as Rose stumbles in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Someone. I've been kidnapped --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's such the damsel in distress, someone LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, has she come to the wrong room!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No kidding!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a joke. It's gotta be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please -- he's going to kill me ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GALES of LAUGHTER at this. Rose backs away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose turns, runs blindly into the bulk that is Funland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geez. You okay, miss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. I need help. I need to get to a  phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do? Sure. Sure. We'll get you to a  phone. Here. (unties her wrists)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh ... this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose looks at him gratefully, mouths 'thank you.' Funland smiles, embarrassed. Leads her down the hallway. Keeps  glancing down at her out of the corner of his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, you look pretty young. How old are  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no. You can't be. I'd say you're  younger than that. A lot younger. Right  in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose steps through two heavy doors. Before her are rows o dining tables set for the night's banquet. Empty and sile Rose frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the -- (realizes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God, no --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funland slaps her across the face. Moves on top of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to play, little girl. We can  make believe it's my special place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his hands around Rose's throat. She chokes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a small world, after all. I love  that song. It's so true. So true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tightens his grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, when we've finished you mustn't tell  anybody that I played with you ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of her, Nathan Diskin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funland looks up, the expression of a boy caught with his hand in the cookie jar, except his hands are around Rose' throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? How -- how did you know my name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian stands there, furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of her. You have no idea what you  almost did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funland drops Rose. She scurries away, choking and coughi Funland cowers under the Corinthian's glare. In a little- voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to kill me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian advances on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't seem to understand the rules,  Funland. Too bad.  (in his face)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I'll have to remind you, then.  Let me tell you, Funland, what the first  rule is -- (he wags a finger)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No killing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian laughs. Funland, panting in fear, laughs, The Corinthian turns, grabs Rose, who shrieks as he pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rope is tossed over a branch. Philip, gagged, no shirt, chest bare and vulnerable, is strung up by his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't bother to ask how you got  Bogeyman's invitation. We'll talk about  something else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are PHILIP's POV -- Nimrod stares up at us. Behind him rows of huge lovely redwoods, a cathedral of trees. An  otherworldly scene, like in a dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you came here to learn. Okay.  We'll teach you. Teach you that this  isn't about sex; it isn't about power; it  isn't about cruelty. (more)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll learn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Nimrod, the Good Doctor steps INTO FRAME. Stares a Philip, staring right at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Good Doctor Likes to skin people  alive. Lip Collector -- well, the name  says it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lip collector steps into frame on the other side, shy hunched over, but still grinning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I am Nimrod, the hunter. I can bone,  joint and gut any animal in minutes. And  you know what we're going to do now,  Philip? (a deadly smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to take turns ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Philip stands up in the forest, looks dazed. OFF SCREEN t is an odd SOUND, the FLUTTERING of many wings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow! When they strung me up, I thought I  was a goner for sure!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death steps up right next to him, but she's facing the  opposite way, looking back toward the clearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you thought, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Philip looks at her, a little confused, unsure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods toward the clearing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, aren't you going to watch? They're  not nearly finished, yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Philip turns, looks back toward the clearing. We hear the final sounds of his body being killed. The reality of his death sinks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's it? That's all I get?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Fraid so --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death squints a little, looking toward the clearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second. I know those guys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So in my line of work I don't get many,  y'know, long term relationships. Huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Philip with interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're one lucky guy, Philip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really. Really-really. Most people worry  their death has no significance. Yours  could be one of the most significant of  all time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death smiles, puts her arm around Philip. He seems to lik it. She walks him away from the clearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, where would you like to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um. You mean, I get to pick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how it works ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They disappear behind a huge redwood. OFF SCREEN is that sound again -- the loud FLUTTERING of many WINGS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death moves down the hallway, looking around with interes peeking into various conference rooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, I don't believe this ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sign reads: 'THERE IS NO SANITY CLAUS.' Inside the room nervous professional man answers a question:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhn, look, as a practicing psychiatrist,  I, uh, well, look, none of you, uh, well,  there's no more evidence of mental  abnormality among us people than amongst,  um, them. Less, maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death raises an eyebrow, moves to the next room. This one titled WOMEN IN SERIAL KILLING. In the front, DOG SOUP si between a NURSE and a WOMAN IN BLACK. They don't look to  pleased as she speaks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell you, I'm sick and tired of women  in our line being stereotyped as black  widows or killer nurses. I'm a serial  killer, and a woman, and I'm proud of it  ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves on to the next room: WE ARE WHAT WE ARE. She pe in to hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... fundamental act of humanity is to  kill. They are the sheep and cattle. But  we know the truth. We're alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death stops, shakes her head in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little brother, what have you done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns around, goes back the way she came --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Typical artist's apartment. Messy, canvasses of many size strewn everywhere. Weirdly, all of the canvasses are BLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul (who we haven't seen in a while, he's Rose's artist  friend, the guy with the nightmares) sits in a large open windowsill, feet dangling over the edge. He looks drunk,  wasted. He turns, stares INTO CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? How did you get in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He follows someone as they move closer -- it is DEATH. Sh shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Didn't mean to disturb you. The  door was open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cigarette?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death holds up a hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? (she just looks at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you come for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm searching for my brother. He's  here somewhere, nearby. I've got to find  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matter of life or death?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death smiles. Glances at the windowsill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be soon enough, Paul. Why rush it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul looks at the many empty canvasses. Haltingly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to think I was special. But I'm  not. I'm just like everyone else. I'm  going to be dead one day, just like  everyone else, and then that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death nods. Moves toward the door. Stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just go ahead and do whatever you want.  It's not going to make any difference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul looks at her questioningly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody always gets the same deal, no  matter what. One lifetime. No more, no  less.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul turns away, a thoughtful look on his face --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: SANDMAN, as he opens his eyes, squints into the streaming in through the window. We hear that loud FLUTTE SOUND -- like the wings of birds --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANDMAN'S POV: looking up as his sister, Death, leans ove him, blocking the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mock ominous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've come for you, little brother!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman struggles, leans up on his elbows. Death laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death watches as Sandman slowly recovers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister -- thank you for coming to my aid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not coming to your aid, I'm here to  kick your butt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman stares at her, frowns. She leans close to him,  explains:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've found your escaped nightmare, little  brother. He's tearing the world apart at  the seams, and near as I can tell it's  your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No empty seats; the place is packed with serial killers, of the faces familiar to us now. The mood is expectant,  excited. Nimrod addresses them; he's become a confident  master of ceremonies:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... they've called him the Eye Guy, and  the Dark Angel, and Shades, and maybe a  thousand other names. But we've always  known it was one man -- (he starts clapping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen. Ladies. Our guest of honor:  the Corinthian!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian leaps onto the stage amid thunderous APPLA He gestures for quiet, and the crowd reluctantly complies

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this on? All right. Many of you know  this story. But for those that don't ... (he coughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once upon a time --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renewed APPLAUSE -- like a rock-concert crowd recognizing opening bars of a favorite song. The Corinthian grins, wa starts over:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once upon a time, the mean Lord of Dreams  was captured. A child was born of his  magic dream sand, making a rift in dreams  ... and allowing your humble servant to  escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian bows low. APPLAUSE rises up; he basks in i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That child, I am happy to say, is here  with us today!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sweeping gesture. From a side door, Rose Walker is whee out -- she's gagged, blindfolded, and bound head-to-toe t moving dolly. Catcalls and screams. She is left in the mi of the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian takes the mic in hand, moves into the crow like a daytime talk show host.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
