dialogues.text: And the Vortex, continued to grow,  weakening the Sand King, allowing your  humble servant to take his magic Ruby  Dreamstone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises the glittering Ruby high above him. CHEERS from crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now, the happy ending. Soon, the  dreams will all be gone ... all there  will be left is reality. (gathers them by eye)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are special people. Very special  people. And the new reality will be  created in the shape of your dreams!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian speaks in an evangelical fervor. He whirls points to Deliverance in his long gray beard --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deliverance! In the new world, you will  cleanse the world of the wicked, and lead  your people to righteousness!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And WE SEE a quick image, FLAMES bursting to life, a hous fire, Deliverance praying as people inside begin to SCREA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the Corinthian whirls, points to Funland --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funland! You will be a funny giant, and  your little friends will come running to  play with you, and never make fun of you  ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And WE SEE it -- Funland, dancing in a line of kids, hold hands, and it's more than a little disconcerting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: on Funland's blissfully smiling face. Someone stands up n to him -- it is Dog Soup, the female serial killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? A question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to ask, uh, how do we know that  it works? The Ruby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian blinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Works? It's already working. Look at this  convention. You're serial killers, for  godsakes. How can we be getting away with  this? Where are the maids -- the  bellboys? You think this is normal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of the audience shift uncomfortably in their chairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian holds the Ruby aloft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems normal -- it has become normal --  because of this. (more)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quoting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Behold, I show you a mystery; we shall  not all sleep, but we shall be changed in  a moment, in the twinkling of an eye ...' (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will walk this world like giants. You  will be the celebrities, the stars --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the room is filled with ADORING MEDIA: spotligh from mini-cams, flashes from cameras.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will be the heroes of books and  movies, and -- uh ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking out into the crowd, we notice a DARK FIGURE, seat unmoving. The Corinthian frowns, but keeps speaking:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and the faces on the cover of People  magazine ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we get a good look: it is SANDMAN, sitting in the cro watching. The Corinthian is unnerved. The reporters stare into the crowd --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are gladiators, and we are  swashbucklers and warriors and ... uh,  kings ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman stands. ALL SOUND DROPS OUT. Only the Sandman and Corinthian seem real -- all others have been reduced to  backdrop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... of the night ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What ... what do you think you are doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian twirls the Ruby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I'm glad you're here. I think  I've got the hang of this. (regards him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you don't look strong enough to make  it interesting. Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must not do this. I forbid you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You abandoned me. I waited for your  return. I remember the gray days that  stretched into years and into decades.  The slow crumbling of walls ... the rooms  that were no longer there ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman lowers his head slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ... am sorry, Corinthian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that doesn't cut it! You see, I  like the waking world. It needs a few  changes, that's all. I'm staying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lightning quick, Sandman reaches beneath his coat, and  extracts his POUCH OF SAND. He tosses a handful --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- into the Corinthian's eyes. He staggers back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He backs away, holds the Ruby up like a talisman, clawing his eyes. Sandman slips quickly to Rose's side. Her bonds fall away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came for me ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lifts her in his arms, and hurries toward a side exit. Corinthian blinks, searching, still unable to see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman sets Rose down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to stop him. He'll destroy the  world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not know if I can stop him. I may  not be strong enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because ... because of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says nothing. Rose stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What ... are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman considers. His brow furrows as he weighs his opti And then he decides --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. I will do nothing.  (trying to convince himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are countless other planes beyond  this one. We can travel them together,  and leave this one to the Corinthian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose stares up at him. She can't believe what he is sayin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cannot find it in me to harm you, Rose.  You did nothing to deserve it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deserve. Deserve has nothing to do with  it, does it? Things just happen sometimes  ... and all you can do is the best you  can with what you've got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sound very much like my sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'd like to meet her sometime. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen -- this is my world. This is where  I live. This is where my friends live. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has to be stopped. (no arguments)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know ... what you are asking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I have to. It's ... it's my  responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman studies her face. She returns his gaze. Tears wel in her eyes. She turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman nods slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is my responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cradles her in his arms, touches her face as her eyes  close --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose's eyes snap open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is another way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Of course. He is nothing but a  dream. And you -- you are that which can  destroy dreams. Together, we can beat  him. Together. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must join our souls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do any two people join their souls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman leans down --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and KISSES HER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors slam open. The Corinthian spins--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman and Rose stand there, hands linked, power radiati from them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come, Corinthian. Let this be finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Let it be finished, one way or the  other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian lunges forward, the RUBY metamorphosing in DAGGER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman pours sand from the pouch into Rose's palm, then own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow my lead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He claps his hands together, draws them apart --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HE HOLDS A SHIELD OF SAND. He parries the Corinthian's  charge, shoves him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose follows suit, creating a sword. She looks at it,  surprised, then lunges forward, swinging for the Corinthi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian ducks, STABS the Ruby Dagger into her leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She CRIES OUT. The sword becomes sand again, cascading to floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman slams the Corinthian with the shield. The ruby da still protrudes from Rose's leg. Sandman hits the Corinth again -- his sunglasses go flying, revealing his eye sock LINED WITH TEETH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cornered, the Corinthian steels himself and PUNCHES --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- THROUGH THE SHIELD. He grabs Sandman by the throat.  Sandman struggles to break free. The Corinthian leans in, SOCKET MOUTHS snapping for Sandman's throat, drawing clos

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the Corinthian STIFFENS -- an eerie double scre issues from his eye sockets. He staggers back --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ruby Dagger has been plunged deep into his back. Rose stands behind him, staring at her handiwork. The Corinthi reaches toward her, almost shrugging -- and then he is de

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose looks up at Sandman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman steps to her, sweeping her up into his arms, look deep into her eyes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THEY KISS AGAIN, passionately, as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman and Rose break their kiss. In best fairy-tale mov fashion, they now stand in the throne room of the palace, dressed in finery. Sandman leads Rose up the steps, to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO THRONES, identical, equal. He gestures for her to sit She does; he takes his place beside her. Rose looks aroun happy wonder at the palace. She turns to look at Sandman, is already watching her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES IN as he takes her hand, their fingers  intertwining --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brother ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death stands there. She is subdued, sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman looks up. A tear runs down his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a lovely final dream you gave  her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman cradles Rose in his arms. Her head lolls back. Sh dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She deserved no less.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death nods. She sweeps an arm across Rose's body --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is the SOUND OF WINGS, and then Death is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman rises. There are mirror tiles on one entire wall. Sandman glances at his many reflections --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Floating just beyond one of them is DESPAIR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Do not enter. I do not want you in my  realm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nor do I wish to be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns away from the mirror as Despair fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian stands in the hallway. He stares at Rose's body, prone on the tarmac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, you're an inspiration to us all. (looks up at Sandman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still have the ruby. It is enough to  kill you. More than enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman stands, reaching beneath his coat, producing his  helm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps it can. It has absorbed much of  my soul-self already. But if you would  fight me, you shall not do it here. The  dream realm is repaired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman puts on his helm, giving his voice an even more  otherworldly sound --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you would steal a dreamlord's power,  than you shall do it in dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman pulls darkness around himself, and then he is gon

dialogues.speaker: COWARD.
dialogues.text: (to the Ruby)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow him. Take me into dreams, my  darling ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RUBY FLASHES BLOOD RED --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LINE OF LIGHT appears, becomes the outline of a door. T door opens, and the Corinthian steps through --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm no mere nightmare now, Sandman. I'm  here to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian stands in a CEMETERY. A grave stands empty

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show yourself, Sandman. You can't hide  forever ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause. No answer. The Corinthian uses the ruby to BLAST section of the cemetery --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and the illusion of a world is RIPPED AWAY, torn like painting. Revealed behind the tear are many CLOCKWORK GEA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you see me, stinkard lord of piss and  mire? Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another BLAST -- the clockworks fly to pieces, as well as rest of the cemetery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revealed behind the clockworks are--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUNDREDS of FACES, floating in darkness, eyes shut in sle A sky of faces, a landscape of faces, surrounding the  Corinthian. This is the world of the Dreaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you see me using your power to rip  your ragtag dreamworld apart? Can you see  me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another BLAST -- the faces twist in pain, wavering. Sever scream out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! Enough, Corinthian! I am here!  Desist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lenses of Sandman's helm reflect the Corinthian, who  smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. You're here. Hello. (indicates the ruby)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a lovely thing, isn't it? It  contains your life. Your magick. Your  power. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the last time you used it, it sucked  out more. Yes? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corinthian ... stop. You are tampering  with the order of things ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHUT UP! I'm going to ruin all of it.  Every bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds the Ruby over his head. It GLOWS. A BEAM knives Sandman's heart. He moans --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that hurt? I bet it does. I bet it  hurts. A lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beam widens. Sandman slumps, seemingly shrinking --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does it feel like? To have the life  sucked out of you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop -- the dreamers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The faces still look on, themselves being drained of  vitality, growing gaunt, withered, desiccated --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hold your life in my hands. I can kill  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He closes his hands around the Ruby, squeezing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This IS your life, dreamsneak. And I'm  crushing it out with my hands!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destiny stands in his garden, reading from his great book His finger traces the words, reaches the bottom of the pa He prepares to turn to the next one --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and HESITATES. Just a moment --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then he turns the page --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian's knuckles are white with strain --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ruby SHATTERS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLOOD-RED LIGHT flares, hurting the eyes, filling the scr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and then it fades, leaving a WHITE SCREEN --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and the small figure of the Corinthian, looking surpri and then smug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It worked. He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can scarcely believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The king is dead. And long live the king!  Look who's in charge of the Dreaming, now ... (glances around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... what's left of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a few steps. The world remains PURE WHITE. He dr to his knees. Alone, by himself, the Corinthian actually  smiles -- a genuine, relieved smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm free again. Finally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Corinthian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PULLS BACK, way back, revealing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian has been standing in the pale white palm o Sandman's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK MORE. Sandman is huge now, a giant. He peers do at the tiny figure of the Corinthian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has been so long. I had forgotten ...  I had forgotten how much of my power I  had placed in that jewel. And you  released it. (considers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt I would have thought of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian looks up at Sandman, not quite cowering, b no longer cocksure. Timid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sandman begins to shrink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You disappoint me, Corinthian. You were  my masterpiece, or so I thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands beside the Corinthian now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nightmare created to be the darkness  and the fear of darkness in every human  heart. A dark mirror, made to reflect  everything about itself that humanity  will not confront.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He touches the Corinthian's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But look at you. Twenty years walking the  earth, and what have you given them?  Nothing. You've told them there are bad  people out there. (sadly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they've known that all along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian wrenches away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you expect me to submit quietly? To go  back -- to never again know the delights  of an eye as it pops between my teeth? Is  that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. That's not it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs the Corinthian by the jaw, tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I created you poorly, then. As I do  uncreate you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corinthian SCREAMS--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His skin dissolves, leaving the skeleton--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The skeleton fades away, except the skull, still in Sandm hand. Sandman stares into its eye sockets filled with tee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him, around him, the sleeping faces FADE IN. Hundr of them, all races, all ages, all genders...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and all sleeping peacefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman TURNS TO CAMERA --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And YOU, that call yourselves collectors --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's behind the podium, addressing the audience of killer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until now, you have all sustained  fantasies in which you are the maltreated  heroes of your own stories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nimrod slouches in his seat. Funland looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comforting daydreams in which,  ultimately, you are shown to be in the  right. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now all the eyes in the room are on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For all of you, the dream is over. I have  taken it away. For this is my judgment on  you:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The killers leave the hotel. Some seem to want to talk to others, but ultimately, they don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you shall know, at all times, and  forever, exactly what you are. And you  shall know just how little that means. (tired)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funland is one of the last. He takes off his cap, and dro it. The wind kicks up, blowing it across the parking lot. killers just drift away, fading into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bright day, not at all proper for a funeral. The white  flowers around the casket look almost festive in the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose's friends are gathered at the gravesite. Most we met the party, including Kelly, Sam (holding Rose's kitten), Paul, who stands at the head of the grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, uh, I'd like to read something ... a  poem, from one of Rose's --  (his voice breaks; he gathers  himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is from Rose's favorite book, and  it, uh -- it meant a lot to her ...  (clears his throat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "In Wonderland they lie "Drifting as the days go by "Watching as the summers die "Lying in the golden gleam ..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The palace has been rebuilt. The surrounding land is gree Sandman stands on a balcony, head inclined, listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "... Life is but a dream."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucien steps onto the balcony, nervous about disturbing  Sandman. Matthew, perched on Lucien's shoulder, is not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, boss. Heads up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman raises his head, but does not look at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My lord ... there are nightmares to be  inspected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman turns. He peers at the two of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucien ... In my absence, you did not  leave. You remained at your post, in the  Library.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah ... yes, lord. I'm a librarian, after  all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is true. Still ...  (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Lucien.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucien is startled -- but genuinely pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You -- you're welcome, my lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew flutters to Sandman's shoulder. Cocks his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've changed, boss ... you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have I? I am still Dream, and I still  have my responsibilities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nightmares..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dream glances down -- almost as though he's looking back the funeral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. But, first, I think something  a bit more ... inspirational.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We recognize Paul's dream: He clings to the spire, unable climb higher, afraid to fall. He grasps for a better  handhold, then glances up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman stands precariously, impossibly, on the very tip the spire, Matthew perched on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who -- who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, buddy. You look screwed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never should have climbed up here! I  learned my lesson ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you? It is sometimes a mistake to  climb. It is always a mistake to never  even make the attempt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm caught here! If I even move, I'll  fall! I'll die! Aren't you scared of  falling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hush, Matthew. (to Paul)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it that bad to fall? Sometimes you  wake, and sometimes, yes, you die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandman turns and nonchalantly walks away -- across thin He pauses, turns back to Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there is a third alternative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul stares into his face. It is the same face that Roder Burgess looked into nearly seventy years earlier: the sam aquiline nose, the same sharp cheekbones, the same dark  eyesbut now it is less harsh. Less foreboding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul swallows. He nods. And --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL LETS GO. He arcs away from the spire, out and down i slow motion. Is he falling -- or is he flying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul wakes up. Across the room, a large blank canvas stan on an easel, beckoning, taunting.  Paul stares at it, the rises. Like a sleepwalker, moves toward it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul mixes paint on a palette --  He uses a roller to create a powder blue sky, like the on his dream --  He sketches in the spire with charcoal --  He begins to paint a figure --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure is in mid-air, having let go of the precipice And it is flying, arms outstretched. But it is not Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is ROSE, smiling as she soars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PUSHES IN on Rose's smiling face, closer and close until detail is lost in nearness, and we
